intro: Diabelia serrata f. viridiramea, commonly known as the green-stemmed diabelia, is a rare variant of the diabelia species characterized by its distinctive green stems. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is native to specific regions in Africa. The plant features serrated leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its botanical interest lies in its unique foliage and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
